content.description: Start sitting underneath the steep prow with your left hand on the arete and your right on a smallish, but good edge.  Hard move to the jug, some compression moves and trickery, and go up the face on good edges and slopers.  A weasel skittered right by us as we were working the problem.
content.location: 150 feet South of Smooth Operator and barely uphill.  Hidden until you get there.

content.description: From a sit on the obvious break in the center of the wall move up and right into the juggy flake feature and topout.
content.location: 150 feet south of Smooth operator, barely uphill.  Or if you park in the lot above the lake and before the north shore ranger station on the right walk down the gravel trail towards the lake and after a a couple hundred feet bust right up the hill and it is a a few hundred feet up the hill.

content.description: Do the first move of What up Weasel and trend left around the corner.
content.location: 150 feet south of Smooth operator, barely uphill.  Or if you park in the lot above the lake and before the north shore ranger station on the right walk down the gravel trail towards the lake and after a a couple hundred feet bust right up the hill and it is a a few hundred feet up the hill.

content.description: Left side of Weasel Warmup boulder.  Sit start by tree and do a tricky pull to crimps and top out up and right on big holds in the crack.  If you go direct up the face it is more sustained and according to reports better and checks in at a 4.
content.location: 150 feet south of Smooth operator, barely uphill.  Or if you park in the lot above the lake and before the north shore ranger station on the right walk down the gravel trail towards the lake and after a a couple hundred feet bust right up the hill and it is a a few hundred feet up the hill.

content.description: On right side of Weasel warmup face head straight up the face starting left hand on the slopey rail feature in the middle of the face and right hand out on the arete.  Tricky.
content.location: 150 feet south of Smooth operator, barely uphill.  Or if you park in the lot above the lake and before the north shore ranger station on the right walk down the gravel trail towards the lake and after a a couple hundred feet bust right up the hill and it is a a few hundred feet up the hill.

content.description: Climb the east face of the block right above Smooth Operator.
content.location: Boulder just up and right of Smooth Operator.

content.description: From the left, trend right along the lip through cool and bad holds and finish up the right arete.
content.location: Tilted Boulder.

content.description: Pull on to the face, with a bitey right side pull left of the arete for the right hand, and an undercling for the left. Â Establish, probably fire to a sloper on the lip then move right to the arete and finish it up.
content.location: Tilted boulder.

content.description: Climb up slab face on north side of Tilted Boulder.
content.location: North side of Tilted Boulder, up hill from Smooth Operator.

content.description: Start low under boulder with left hand on sharp crimp and right on large pinch under roof.  Bump your hands up the right corner of boulder and top-out.
content.location: Same boulder as Spit out the Seeds. Between Mixed Emotion and What Up Weasel at top of talus field.

content.description: Start with left hand on sharp crimp and right on ok edge by corner.  Throw up a left heel-hook and matle up to good holds.  Tricky!
content.location: Approx. 50ft. south of What Up Weasel.  Between What Up Weasel and Mixed Emotion.

content.description: Start under a bulge and work up poor features to an easy topout.
content.location: Just around the corner from Smooth Operator.

content.description: Stand start with good side-pulls and work your way up left to slopey arete, finish the slick top-out.  Super cool.
content.protection: Pads and spotters.  The landing is flat, but is large and rocky.
content.location: First main boulder problem up hill and left from boulder by trail.

content.description: Starting right hand on jug and left hand on a cool pinch old on the arete, climb out the steep arete doing some awesome and fun moves then do an interesting topout above the boulder.
content.protection: More pads the better, at least a few.  Spotter on boulder for top out is key.
content.location: From Smooth operator parking (parking lot on right above the lake just before north shore ranger station)  Walk down the gravel path toward the lake 20 feet and look right.  You will see it about a hundred feet off the trail.

content.description: Start low matched on good undercling.  Work you way up and out boulder using foot trickery and raw power.  Lots of holds and really fun movement!   This problem would be 3 to 4 stars if the top-out wasn't so dabby.
content.location: On Tilted Boulder, left of Tilted Boulder project.   Hike up behind Smooth Operator and look for the Tilted Boulder.

content.description: From a stand with a ledge, climb the tall arete.  Pads and spotters recommended.  Tall and committing near the top.
content.location: Right of Smooth Operator by 50 feet.  Just below the tilted project.  Uphill from sir Mix A lot.  uphill and just towards the lake a minute or two from the Smooth Operator parking.

content.description: Start with a down pulling pinchy hold and a small gaston just next to it.  Gain a gaston and finish it up. 3 moves with my method.  Maybe a 1 star Boulder but a decent landing and easy access makes it cooler?
content.location: Just right of Smooth Operator and cheddarmilker proj.

content.description: Same start as 'What Up Weasel'. Reach the good left hand above the lip (just as in What Up Weasel, see photo) then grab good right hand (underside of overhang) and launch for the prominent arete.  Work your way back (climbers) left up the arete avoiding the tree and topping out.
content.protection: With 3-4 pads and spotters the landing is very safe.
content.location: What Up Weasel Boulder

climbs.name: Le Craguette
climbs.fa: ?? Ian CB, Anna Boatman, Eric Cashman

content.description: A fun and sweet feature very close to the car, definitely worth checking out. This faces the parking lot, Iâm surprised it hadnât been noticed. Sit start with a gaston for the right and a low spot on the arete for the left. Â Climb rightwards along the arete and mantle on good holds.
content.protection: 3 pads is nice. There is a tier.
content.location: 50 feet below Smooth Operator, facing north. Â A very short approach from the Smooth Operator parking.. just walk down the trail 40/50 feet towards the lake then head uphill for a minute. Â Visible if you know what to look for..

content.description: A nice short arete climb with a couple cool moves.  Sit start on 2 good deep crimps that are side by side to the left of the arete.
content.protection: 1-2 pads.  There's a big drop off but it would hard to blow it so badly as to go tumbling down.
content.location: Boulder just uphill from What Up Weasel.  To the right of Weasel in Yo Pants.

content.description: Start sitting with a left side pull and right slope.  Bust a tough move right then press/ mantle your way up.
content.location: Right behind tilted project and/or 100 feet or so above smooth operator. A steep few minute walk from the car.

content.description: Start hugging both aretes just right of the tilted project and go straight up, staying on the face.
content.location: Above Smooth Operator.

content.description: From a sit climb the square cut arÃªte.
content.location: Just behind tilted project, next to Funk Show Brother and above and right of Smooth Operator.

content.description: Start right hand in juggy hold and left hand low on a sprag like pinch sitting on a boulder and trick up the mini overhang onto the slab above.  Kind of a funny little problem that turned out to be quite scary due to the poor landing and potential to have a bad fall down the hill into the talus.  Some tricky moves.  Not amazing but maybe worth checking out if you're in the area.
content.protection: Good spot is super important - that's where the name came from.  3-4 or more pads would be good.
content.location: About 100 feet above the mixed emotions boulder.  Or a few minute traverse from what up weasel towards the beach.  Maybe easiest to approach from above.

content.description: Sit down start of Smooth Operator.    Start on slopey ledge down and right of the start to SO.  Bump out left to crack and get into the start of SO.  Top out same as SO
content.location: Smooth Operator Boulder

content.description: Start from a stand on pads, left on a crimp sidepull with a thumb catch and right pinching the heck out of the arete just to the right.Pick a foot, and with difficulty and maybe a slightÂ hop off the pad to get going, gain holds above and top out the arete.An elegant, pure and hard boulder with a distinct crux. Â Shorter folks may need to stack pads.The sit or a lower startÂ will be very difficult but it probably is all there.Also worth noting, jump start with right hand on the pinch for v9 probably.
content.location: Tilted boulder is just uphill and right of Smooth Operator.I think the easiest access is to walk up the West Bluff Trail a couple minutes (100 yards) then skirt the base of the first cliff band on the left you reach to the boulder.Five minutes from the car.

content.description:
A very accessible bouldering area on the northern most portion of the West Bluff! Approaches range from 30 seconds to less than ten minutes. Â Smooth Operator, the namesake, is an old school V4, with a high and slick topout. Â Sir Mix A lot and Le Craguette are a mere minute from the car and check in at V4. The Tilted Boulder has a cluster of fun, harder lines and very hard undone projects. Â What Up Weasel is a favorite of the area too clocking in at V7 and has a number of enjoyable problems just next to it. Â North by Northwest is an outstanding and fairly serious V2.

This area is definitely worth a visit!
